omp2gpu.analysis

Class AnalysisTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • omp2gpu.analysis.AnalysisTools

  • public abstract class AnalysisTools
extends java.lang.Object
    AnalysisTools provides tools that perform various analyses for OpenMP-to-CUDA translation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnalysisTools.REGIONMAP
      Class REGIONMAP represents map from variables to their region.

      static void advLiveGVariableAnalysis(CFGraph cfg, boolean includeBackEdge)
      Intra-procedural, backward data-flow analysis to compute advLiveG_out, a set of live GPU variables, which may be accessed in later nodes and refer to the same cudaMalloced data.
      static void annotateBarriers(Procedure proc, CFGraph cfg)
      For each barrier node, add the following mapping: - If a barrier node's type = "S2P", put ("kernelRegion", pStmt) mapping - If a barrier node's type = "P2S", put ("pKernelRegion", pStmt) mapping where pStmt is a parallel region related to the barrier.

      For each kernel region, which will be transformed into a CUDA kernel, 1) add information of the enclosing procedure name and kernel ID.

      • addRangeDomainToCFG

        public static void addRangeDomainToCFG(DFAGraph cfg,
                       java.util.Map<Statement,RangeDomain> range_map)
        For now, just union them once in reverse post order. This method is inefficient because we need to rebuild RangeDomain for intermediate nodes which do not represent a statement in the IR. It seems like this is the only way to provide range information correctly.

      • getOmpSharedVariables

        public static java.util.Set<Symbol> getOmpSharedVariables(Traversable tr)
        Return a set of OpenMP shared variables existing the the input code, tr. (Shared variables are searched intraprocedurally.)
        Parameters:
        tr - input code region
        Returns:
        set of OpenMP shared variable symbols in the input code tr

      • getIpOmpSharedVariables

        public static java.util.Set<Symbol> getIpOmpSharedVariables(Traversable tr)
        Return a set of OpenMP shared variables existing the the input code, tr. This is an interprocedural analysis; if the input code has function calls, the called functions are searched recursively, and the return set contains original symbols. (If shared variable is a function parameter, corresponding argument symbol is returned.)
        Parameters:
        tr - input code region
        Returns:
        set of OpenMP shared variable symbols in the input code tr

      • getIpAccessedVariableSymbols

        public static java.util.Set<Symbol> getIpAccessedVariableSymbols(Traversable t)
        Returns the set of symbols accessed in the traversable object, t. The returned set includes local symbols in t and global variables and static variables accessed in t and functions called within t.
        Parameters:
        t - the traversable object.
        Returns:
        the set of accessed symbols.

      • getIpAccessedGlobalorStaticSymbols

        public static java.util.Set<Symbol> getIpAccessedGlobalorStaticSymbols(SymbolTable st)
        Returns the set of global or static symbols accessed in the input SymbolTable object, st. If st contains function calls, each function is recursively checked.
        Parameters:
        st - input SymbolTable object.
        Returns:
        the set of accessed global or static symbols.

      • getOrgSymbolOfExternOne

        public static Symbol getOrgSymbolOfExternOne(Symbol inSym,
                             Program prog)
        Find the original symbol that the input extern symbol, inSym, refers to.
        Parameters:
        inSym - input extern symbol
        prog - program where the input symbol belongs.
        Returns:
        returns the original symbol that the input extern symbol refers to. If the input symbol is not an extern symbol, return input symbol itself. If no original symbol is found, return null.

      • findOrgSymbol

        public static java.util.List findOrgSymbol(Symbol inSym,
                           Traversable t)
        Find the original symbol of the input symbol, inSym. If the input symbol is a function parameter, and the corresponding argument is complex, - return a list of the original symbol only. Else if the input symbol is a global variable, - return a list of the symbol and the parent TranslationUnit Else if the input symbol is a static variable in a procedure - return a list of the original symbol and the parent Procedure Else if the input symbol is a local variable in a main procedure - return a list of the original symbol and the parent Procedure Else if the input symbol is a local variable or value-passed parameter of a procedure - return a list of the original symbol only. Else - return an empty list.
        Parameters:
        inSym - input symbol
        t - procedure where inSym exists
        Returns:
        list of the original symbol and the parent TranslationUnit/Procedure.

      • findEnclosingParallelRegion

        public static Traversable findEnclosingParallelRegion(Traversable t)
        Find the enclosing parallel region interprocedurally. If multiple parallel regions exist, the first one will be returned.
        Parameters:
        t - input code from where search starts.
        Returns:
        enclosing parallel region

      • checkSharedVariableAccess

        public static boolean checkSharedVariableAccess(Symbol sharedVar,
                                Traversable tr)
        Check whether a shared symbol, sharedVar, is accessed in the code, tr. If tr is a function call, this searches the called function too.
        Parameters:
        sharedVar - shared variable to be searched
        tr - Traversable tr
        Returns:
        true if the shared variable, sharedVar, is accessed in the code tr.

      • ipCollectPragmas

        public static <T extends PragmaAnnotation> java.util.List<T> ipCollectPragmas(Traversable t,
                                                              java.lang.Class<T> pragma_cls,
                                                              java.lang.String key)
        Returns a list of pragma annotations that contain the specified string keys and are attached to annotatable objects within the traversable object t. For example, it can collect list of OpenMP pragmas having a work-sharing directive for within a specific procedure. If functions are called within the traversable object (@code t), the called functions are recursively searched.
        Parameters:
        t - the traversable object to be searched.
        pragma_cls - the type of pragmas to be searched for.
        key - the keyword to be searched for.
        Returns:
        the list of matching pragma annotations.

      • markIntervalForKernelRegions

        public static void markIntervalForKernelRegions(Program program)
        Insert barriers before and after each kernel region, so that other analysis can easily distinguish kernel regions from CPU regions.

                           RangeDomain rd,
                           java.util.Set<Symbol> def_vars)
        Returns a map from a variable to its section This method is the same as DataFlowTools.getUseSectionMap(), except that if symbol is an AccessSymbol, it is replaced with its base symbol.

      • getDefSectionMap

        public static Section.MAP getDefSectionMap(Expression e,
                           RangeDomain rd,
                           java.util.Set<Symbol> def_vars)
        Returns a map from a variable to its section This method is the same as DataFlowTools.getUseSectionMap(), except that if symbol is an AccessSymbol, it is replaced with its base symbol.

      • annotateBarriers

        public static void annotateBarriers(Procedure proc,
                    CFGraph cfg)
        For each barrier node, add the following mapping: - If a barrier node's type = "S2P", put ("kernelRegion", pStmt) mapping - If a barrier node's type = "P2S", put ("pKernelRegion", pStmt) mapping where pStmt is a parallel region related to the barrier. This mapping is needed for CFG-based analysis, such as liveGVariableAnalysis() or reachingGMallocAnalysis(), to identify kernel regions.
        Parameters:
        proc -
        cfg -

      • liveGVariableAnalysis

        public static void liveGVariableAnalysis(CFGraph cfg,
                         boolean includeBackEdge)
        Intra-procedural, backward data-flow analysis to compute liveG_out, a set of live GPU variables, which may be accessed in later nodes. Input : CFGraph cfg of a procedure called by CPU. Output : liveG set for each node in cfg liveG_out(exit-node) = {} : only intra-procedural analysis for ( node m : successor nodes of node n ) liveG_out(n) += liveG_in(m) // + : union liveG_in(n) = liveG_out(n) + GEN(n) - KILL(n) // + : union where, GEN(n) = set of shared variables - if n is a barrier node before a kernel region () - otherwise KILL(n) = set of shared variables accessed in a function call - if n represents a function call set of R/O shared scalar variables in a kernel region - if the variables do not exist in liveG_out set and if shrdSclrCachingOnSM option is on and if n is a barrier node before a kernel region. () - otherwise Since this analysis is MAY analysis, inaccurate analysis will cause that some necessary cudaFree() calls are omitted, incurring garbages in GPU global memory. For each kernel region, liveG_out set is stored in a barrier just before the kernel region. To run this analysis, markIntervalForKernelREgins() and annotateBarriers() should be called before this method.
        Parameters:
        cfg - control flow graph of a procedure of interest.
        includeBackEdge - back edge in a For loop is added if true.

      • advLiveGVariableAnalysis

        public static void advLiveGVariableAnalysis(CFGraph cfg,
                            boolean includeBackEdge)
        Intra-procedural, backward data-flow analysis to compute advLiveG_out, a set of live GPU variables, which may be accessed in later nodes and refer to the same cudaMalloced data. Input : CFGraph cfg of a procedure called by CPU. Output : advLiveG set for each node in cfg advLiveG_out(exit-node) = {} : only intra-procedural analysis for ( node m : successor nodes of node n ) advLiveG_out(n) += advLiveG_in(m) // + : union advLiveG_in(n) = advLiveG_out(n) + GEN(n) - KILL(n) // + : union where, GEN(n) = set of shared variables - if n is a barrier node before a kernel region () - otherwise KILL(n) = set of re-malloced shared variables - if n is a barrier node before a kernel region set of shared variables accessed in a function call - if n represents a function call set of R/O shared scalar variables in a kernel region - if the variables do not exist in advLiveG_out set and if shrdSclrCachingOnSM option is on and if n is a barrier node before a kernel region. () - otherwise This analysis differs from liveGVariableAnalysis, since this checks whether the GPU variables accessed in later nodes refer to the same cudaMalloced variables. Therefore, in this analysis, live GPU variables mean GPU variables that are accessed in later node and NOT reMalloced. Since this analysis is MAY analysis, inaccurate analysis will cause that some necessary cudaFree() calls are omitted, incurring garbages in GPU global memory. For each kernel region, advLiveG_out set is stored in a barrier just before the kernel region. To run this analysis, markIntervalForKernelREgins(), annotateBarriers(), liveGVariableAnalysis(), and reachingGMallocAnalysis() should be called before this method.
        Parameters:
        cfg - control flow graph of a procedure of interest.
        includeBackEdge - back edge in a For loop is added if true.

      • reachingGMallocAnalysis

        public static void reachingGMallocAnalysis(CFGraph cfg)
        Intra-procedural, forward data-flow analysis to compute reachingGMalloc_in, a set of GPU variables mallocated in the previous nodes. Input : CFGraph cfg of a procedure called by CPU. Output : reachingGMalloc set for each node in cfg reachingGMalloc_in(entry-node) = {} : only intra-procedural analysis for ( node m : predecessor nodes of node n ) reachingGMalloc_in(n) ^= reachingGMalloc_out(m) // ^ : intersection reachingGMalloc_out(n) = reachingGMalloc_in(n) + GEN(n) - KILL(n) // + : union where, GEN(n) = set of shared variables - if n is a barrier node before a kernel region () - otherwise KILL(n) = set of cudaFreed shared variables - if n is a barrier node before a kernel region set of shared variables accessed in a function call - if n represents a function call set of R/O shared scalar variables in a kernel region - if the variables do not exist in reachingGMalloc_in set and if shrdSclrCachingOnSM option is on and if n is a barrier node before a kernel region. () - otherwise For each kernel region, reachingGMalloc_in set is stored in a barrier just before the kernel region. To run this analysis, markIntervalForKernelRegins(), annotateBarriers(), and liveGVariableAnalysis() should be called before this method. [CAUTION] This analysis assumes that the procedure of interest (cfg) is called by CPU, even though it can contain kernel function calls.
        Parameters:
        cfg - control flow graph of a procedure of interest.

      • cudaMallocFreeAnalsys

        public static void cudaMallocFreeAnalsys(CFGraph cfg)
        Forward data-flow analysis to compute cudaMallocSet, a set of GPU variables that are newly cudaMalloced before a kernel region, and cudaFreeSet, a set of GPU variables that are cudaFreed after the kernel region. These two sets are stored in barrier nodes before/after each kernel region. To run this analysis, markIntervalForKernelRegins(), annotateBarriers(), liveGVariableAnalysis(), and reachingGMallocAnalysis() should be called before this method. [CAUTION] This analysis assumes that the procedure of interest (cfg) is called by CPU, even though it can contain kernel function calls.
        Parameters:
        cfg - control flow graph of a procedure of interest.

      • residentGVariableAnalysis

        public static void residentGVariableAnalysis(CFGraph cfg)
        Intra-procedural, forward data-flow analysis to compute residentGVariables, a set of GPU variables residing in the GPU global memory. Input : CFGraph cfg of a procedure called by CPU. Output : residentGVariable set for each node in cfg residentGVars_in(entry-node) = {} : only intra-procedural analysis for ( node m : predecessor nodes of node n ) residentGVars_in(n) ^= residentGVars_out(m) // ^ : intersection residentGVars_out(n) = residentGVars_in(n) + GEN(n) - KILL(n) // + : union where, GEN(n) = set of shared variables - if n is a barrier node after a kernel region () - otherwise KILL(n) = set of cudaFreed shared variables - if n is a barrier node after a kernel region set of reduction variables used in the kernel region - if n is a barrier node after a kernel region set of shared variables accessed in a function call - if n represents a function call set of shared variables modified in a CPU region - if n represents a node in a CPU region set of R/O shared scalar variables in a kernel region - if the variables do not exist in residentGVars_in set and if shrdSclrCachingOnSM option is on and if n is a barrier node after a kernel region. () - otherwise For each kernel region, residentGVars_in set is stored in a barrier just before the kernel region. To run this analysis, markIntervalForKernelRegins(), annotateBarriers() liveGVariableAnalysis(), reachingGMalloc(), and cudaMallocFreeAnalysis() should be called before this method. [CAUTION] This analysis assumes that the procedure of interest (cfg) is called by CPU, even though it can contain kernel function calls.
        Parameters:
        cfg - control flow graph of a procedure of interest.

      • updateSymbols

        public static void updateSymbols(Traversable t,
                 java.util.HashSet<Symbol> old_set,
                 java.util.HashSet<Symbol> new_set,
                 boolean isShared)
        For each symbol in the old_set, If it is accessed in the region t, - find a symbol with the same name in the SymbolTable, and put the new symbol into the new_set. - If no symbol is found in the table, put the old symbol into the new_set
        Parameters:
        t - region, from which symbol search starts.
        old_set - Old Symbol data set from OmpAnnotation.
        new_set - New Symbol data set to be replaced for the old_set.
        isShared - True if this update is for the shared data set.

      • updateSymbols2

        public static void updateSymbols2(Traversable t,
                  java.util.HashSet<Symbol> old_set,
                  java.util.HashSet<Symbol> new_set,
                  boolean isShared)
        For each symbol in the old_set, If it is accessed in the region t, - find a symbol with the same name in the accessed symbol set, and put the new symbol into the new_set. - If no symbol is found in the table, put the old symbol into the new_set This method should be used instead of updateSymbols() if the input old_set contains a local symbol that is not visible in the current input region; in this case, updateSymbols() will update wrong symbol if a global symbol with the same name as the local symbol exists. This method keeps local symbols even if they are not visible in the current input region. However, this method can be used only if IDExpressions in the input region have correct links to their symbols. If the input region is cloned cone, IDExpressions may contain stale links to their symbols.
        Parameters:
        t - region, from which symbol search starts.
        old_set - Old Symbol data set from OmpAnnotation.
        new_set - New Symbol data set to be replaced for the old_set.
        isShared - True if this update is for the shared data set.

                               java.lang.String separator)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the converted string, which is a list of symbol names

      • findReductionSymbols

        public static java.util.Set<Symbol> findReductionSymbols(Traversable region)
        Find reduction symbols used in the input region. FIXME: currently, O2GTranslator.reductionTransformation() can not handle the cases where reduction is used in a function called in a parallel region. Therefore, this method does not check reduction variables used in a function called in the input region.
        Parameters:
        region - input region
        Returns:
        HashSet of reduction symbols used in the region

      • isCalledByRef

        public static int isCalledByRef(Symbol sym,
                FunctionCall fCall)
        Check if the input symbol, sym, is passed by reference in the function call, fCall.
        Parameters:
        sym - input symbol to check
        fCall - function call of interest
        Returns:
        -2 if procedure definition of the function call can not be found or -1 if the input symbol is not passed by reference or -3 if an error occurs or index of the first argument where the input symbol is passed by reference

        Parameters:
        sym - input symbol
        t - traversable to check
        Returns:
        true if the input symbol is defined in the traversable.

      • annotateUserDirectives

        public static void annotateUserDirectives(Program program,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> userDirectives)
        For each kernel region, which will be transformed into a CUDA kernel, 1) add information of the enclosing procedure name and kernel ID. The annotation has the following form: #pragma cuda ainfo procname(procedure-name) kernelid(kernel-id) 2) apply user directives if existing. 3) if maxNumOfCudaThreadBlocks option exists, add maxnumofblocks(N) clause to each kernel region.
        Parameters:
        program - input program

      • isCudaCall

        public static boolean isCudaCall(FunctionCall fCall)

      • containsKernelFunctionCall

        public static boolean containsKernelFunctionCall(Traversable t)
        Returns true if there is a KernelFunctionCall within the traversable.
        Parameters:
        t - traversable object to be searched.
        Returns:
        true if t contains a function call.

      • checkKernelFunctions

        public static void checkKernelFunctions(Program prog)
        Check whether a CUDA kernel function calls C standard library functions that are not supported by CUDA runtime systems. If so, CUDA compiler will fail if they are not inlinable.
        Parameters:
        prog -

      • getArrayAccess

        public static ArrayAccess getArrayAccess(Expression iExp)
        Search input expression and return an ArrayAccess expression if existing; if there are multiple ArrayAccess expressions, the first one will be returned. If there is no ArrayAccess, return null.
        Parameters:
        iExp - input expression to be searched.
        Returns:
        ArrayAccess expression

      • getArrayAccesses

        public static java.util.List<ArrayAccess> getArrayAccesses(Expression iExp)
        Search input expression and return a list of ArrayAccess expressions if existing; If there is no ArrayAccess, return empty list.
        Parameters:
        iExp - input expression to be searched.
        Returns:
        list of ArrayAccess expressions

      • ipaContainsBarrierInRegion

        public static boolean ipaContainsBarrierInRegion(Traversable region)
        Run interprocedural analysis to find whether the region contains a barrier or not.
        Parameters:
        region - : a region to be searched.
        Returns:
        : returns true if the region contains a barrier.

                 java.lang.String symName)

        Parameters:

        symName - symbol name being searched for
        Returns:
        the first symbol amaong the symbol set whose name is the same as the specified string

      • getBaseSymbols

        public static java.util.HashSet<Symbol> getBaseSymbols(java.util.Set<Symbol> iset)
        For each symbol in input set, iset, if it is an AccessSymbol, base symbol is added to output set else if it is not a class member, the symbol itself is added to the output set.
        Parameters:
        iset -
        Returns:
        output set of base symbols

      • getAccessedVariables

        public static java.util.Set<Symbol> getAccessedVariables(Statement stmt)
        returns a set of all accessed symbols except Procedure symbols and member symbols of a class. For AccessSymbol, only base symbols are included.
